isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: Except for the PTO gears, the left and right countershaft assemblies are identical and reassembled in the same manner.
Reverse, low, 1st and 2nd speed gears are part of the shaft and are not serviceable.

step1.para: Press the 3rd speed gear on the countershaft, long hub of gear to countershaft front ( Figure 178).

figure.caption: Figure 178. Place 3rd Speed Gear on Countershaft

step1.para: Start the PTO gear onto countershaft, bullet-nose side of teeth facing up and toward the rear of the shaft ( Figure 179). Align keyway of the drive gear with the key in the countershaft and press BOTH gears onto shaft, long hub of the drive gear against PTO gear.

figure.caption: Figure 179. Start PTO Gear onto Countershaft

note.para: The left countershaft assembly has a 47-tooth PTO gear; the right countershaft assembly has a 45-tooth PTO gear.

figure.caption: Figure 180. Mark Left Countershaft With "L" and Right With "R"

step1.para: Install the drive gear retaining snap ring in the groove on the front of each countershaft ( Figure 181).

figure.caption: Figure 181. Install Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Use a flanged end driver to install bearing inner race on the countershaft, shoulder of the race against the shoulder of the countershaft ( Figure 182).

figure.caption: Figure 182. Install Bearing Inner Race on Countershaft
